page.title: 01A CONCISE OVERVIEW OF BLOCK
page.content:
This block lies in the County of Dorset 3 miles south west of Sherborne and consists predominantly of farmland with a total of l2 farms within the area. The main area of population is found in the village of Longburton in the north west corner of the block. Smaller areas of population are found in the hamlets of Folke, Caundle Marsh and Bishops Down.
The majority of the farmland is rough grazing for dairy herds and some sheep with a small amount of land used for arable crops. There are small areas of deciduous woodland dotted over the block and two small brooks cross it from east to west namely Caundle Brook and The Cam. The land is low lying with the highest point 350 feet above sea level just south of Longburton.
